page.title: 05Trade In Bawdeswell
page.content: Tradesmen include the following; builder, butcher, garage, hairdresser, general stores, post office and farm & garden machinery. The Old Rectory has been converted into a restaurant, specialising in Victorian menus. House to house deliveries are made of mail, papers, milk, fish, bread and coal. The main stream of traffic on the A1067 now by-passes Bawdeswell, but there are daily buses to Norwich and Fakenham, and a weekly one to the nearest market town of East Dereham, mainly used by shoppers attracted by the cheaper prices of the supermarkets. Refuse is collected weekly by County Council vehicles. There is a public telephone box in the village although many houses have telephones. The Doctor's surgery is at N. Elmham, 7 miles away, but there is a cemetary in the village!
